product_overview: MediTrack is a comprehensive medicine management platform designed to facilitate seamless interaction between general users, pharmacies, suppliers, and administrators. It supports medicine inventory management, online ordering, eSewa payment integration, and user reviews to streamline the healthcare supply chain.
core_goals: Enable secure user authentication and role-based access control to ensure data privacy and personalized experiences.
Provide role-specific dashboards for Admins, Users, Suppliers, and Pharmacies to manage their respective functionalities efficiently.
Support comprehensive medicine management including inventory tracking, stock updates, and categorization.
Allow users to manage their medicine orders through a cart and order system with detailed order histories.
Integrate eSewa payment gateway to offer a secure and convenient payment option for users.
Enable users to submit and view medicine reviews and ratings to assist informed purchasing decisions.
key_features: JWT-based authentication with role-specific registration and login, supporting Admin, General User, Supplier, and Pharmacy roles.
Role-based dashboards directing users to their respective homepages after login.
Medicine management features allowing Admins and Suppliers to create, update, and manage medicine inventory and stock levels.
Cart management for users to add medicines, update quantities, and place orders with detailed order history views.
Integration with the eSewa payment gateway for seamless and secure transaction processing.
Capability for users to submit reviews and ratings for medicines, enhancing product feedback and user engagement.
user_flow_summary: Users register on the platform with role-specific fields: general users register with basic info, pharmacies provide organization name and license number.
Users log in using email and password, then are redirected to their role-specific dashboards.
Admins and suppliers manage medicine inventory through intuitive interfaces to add, edit, or delete medicines and track stock levels.
General users browse medicines, add them to their cart, modify quantities as required, and proceed to checkout with eSewa payment.
Users view their past orders and order details in their order history page.
Users submit reviews and ratings for medicines which are displayed for other users to see.
validation_criteria: Verify successful registration for all roles with required fields, including license details for pharmacies.
Ensure login authentication works securely with JWT tokens and unauthorized access is prevented.
Confirm role-specific dashboard access and functionality upon login.
Test medicine management functionalities for create, update, and delete operations reflecting correct stock levels.
Validate cart and order workflows including quantity updates, order placement, and order history accuracy.
Confirm successful payment processing via eSewa integration during checkout.
Ensure reviews and ratings can be submitted and displayed correctly for medicines.
Perform end-to-end testing of registration and login via the web frontend and backend, accessible at localhost endpoints as specified.
